modName: Aerith and Yuffie Staffs and Weapons
summary: Adds Aerith's Fairy Tale, Guard Staff, Princess Guard, and a weaponized flower basket. Also adds Yuffie's shuriken, razor ring, and pinwheel. Last but not least: moogles!
descriptionHtml:
Update V1.6 - Final!

"Probably" won't update this again . . . so enjoy the final spoils:

[melee]
. Yuffie's pinwheel weapon - wielded like a sword
. Yuffie's razor ring - wielded like a dagger (work well for dual wield).
. Combat moogle - Yes, you can pummel your enemies to death with a moogle! Betcha always wanted to that? =P Wields like an axe. I chose to offset it a bit so it wouldn't be "half emerged into your leg" when sheathed. So now it sorta "floats" next to you when not in use. Which could be cool if you want a little moogle levitating right next to you.

[staff]
. Fire Moogle - Your fiery pal. Sits on your hand--I sorta thought of Lulu's dolls from FF-X as inspiration. Unfortunately the magic effect is way out in front like it's a staff you're holding
. Frost Moogle - Frosty!
. Sparks Moogle - Electrifying

[shield]
. Something called a "Moogle Booster Shield." What does it do? It speeds up stamina regeneration by 50%. Wield with the combat moogle for a balanced set. =P

[props]
. A useless doll
. An even more useless statue--for amusement factor only. Crouch (sneak) for the best odds of it "landing" upright.

--One additional change is an adjustment to the hand position for the shuriken, which was a bit too close to the center I thought before.

***

Update V1.5 - Mod known now as "Aerith and Yuffie Staffs and Weapons."
. Add's Yuffie's shuriken. For now that's the only Yuffie item, but I may add more later.
. Wielded like one-handed sword--which was in part necessity since because when I originally had it as an axe, it clipped badly when not wielded (due to some axis adjustments required so it didn't clip the arm when wielded).

***


Update V1.4 - Small (weaponized) flower basket:
. One of Aerith's signature items is her beloved flower basket. So I created a small one that can be equipped either as a shield or a one-handed weapon, based on an axe--don't expect it to sit well on the hip when not wielded. ^^''''
. I also tweaked the textures of the Fairy Tale staff, specifically with the gold metal and wood.

Before you install I would unequip any of the staffs in this mod and do a new save--just in case you get a CTD (it would be mainly due to the texture changes to the Fairy Tale).

The basket mesh is my own creation, but the flowers inside the flower basket are vanilla Skyrim ones.


****

Update V1.3 - Fairy Tale Staff:
. Finally the mysterious staff is revealed! *Listens for an appreciative crescendo of applause* *Hears only silence* Well, I'm sure everyone is just off doing something else at the moment. =P *ahem*

** IMPORTANT **
. Make a new game save before you install--just to be on the safe side.
. See the note about the EX version of the staff (invisibility and funky eyes) before you use the EX version.

The following staffs are are added to the game:
. Fairy Tale Ultimate: A shield-based staff that has three levels of enchantment (which I call the "Great Gospel"): fortify health (50), magicka (100), and stamina (25) [active effect]; Regenerate health, magicka, stamina twice as fast while blocking; cast Guardian Circle when a power bash is done (related power bash perk for Blocking must be unlocked).
. Fairy Tale of Paralysis: Standard staff that casts Paralyze.
. Fairy Tale of Shiva: Standard staff that casts Icy Spear.
. Fairy Tale EX (caution if using!): A shield-based staff that boosts health and magicka, and when blocking makes you invisible. WARNING: your eyes may go "funky" after using the invisibility, restarting your game should fix it. I'm not sure why it does that, it's just using a normal invisibility effect--albeit in a way not intended . . . (seems to be a known game bug with invisibility)

****

Update V1.2 - Metal texture tweak & 2-handed Melee version of the Guard Staff:
The mysterious new staff (mentioned in my post) is not included in this update (still have a ways to go on that). I thought, though, with the addition of a two-handed melee staff (three versions), an update was warranted. If, however, you prefer the more plastic-like (IMO) texture of the Guard Staff, you may wish to skip the update, or revert to V1.1

New Guard Staffs:
. Guard Staff 2H: Unechanted; 50 base value for damage (will vary by perk or other active affects).
. Guard Staff 2H Chill: Enchanted; deals 30 points frost damage with a chance to paralyze target for 2 seconds
. Guard Staff 2H Fury: Boosts Elemental Fury by 10+ (the staff has a swirling effect when wielded).

[Highly recommended to make an extra save before you install the mod]

****

UPDATE V1.1 - Guard Staff:
Before you install I HIGHLY recommend making a new save. I've found even the most minor of changes can cause CTDs when you install from your last save (even a simple texture update has done this for me @_X).

WHAT'S NEW:
Adds Aerith's Guard Staff to the game in five versions:
. Guard Staff: Shield staff that boosts your health.
. Guard Staff of Smite: Shield staff that boosts destruction magic (I think . . . I set it, but there doesn't seem to be any obvious way of telling if it actually is)
. Guard Staff of Fire: Enchanted staff with Fireball.
. Guard Staff of Frost: Enchanted staff with Frostbite.
. Guard Staff of Light: Enchanted staff with Magelight (I actually itended this to be a heal self staff, but there doesn't appear to be any staff echantments like that. Perhaps when I get more adept at the CK I'll make one--but my attempts to turn the Guardian Circle spell into a staff enchantment failed miserably T_T).

As with the Princess Guard you can either get these with console commands (help "Guard Staff") or by forging.

This is a FULL update, so it will replace the original version (V1).

I probably won't update this mod again. If I do another mod (no promises) it may or may not be Aerith related. =P

****

ABOUT V1:
Adds Aerith's Princess Guard staff to the game. Two are shield-based, and two normal staves:
. Princess Guard: Shield enchanted to boost recovery rate (50%)
. Princess Guard EX: A clone of the Spellbreaker--when blocking an added magic effect of a ward is added.
. Princess Prayer: Enchanted staff with Heal Other
. Princess Smite: Enchanted staff with Wall of Storms


****

Items can be acquired either by the ever omnipotent command console (use the above names for searching) or crafted at a blacksmith forge, under the MISC category.

****

This is my first game mod--ever, so no doubt I could have done this or that better. Hopefully you'll find it "passible." =P

Also, I highly recommend Hardarg's Aerith Clothing mod to complete the Aerith Gainsborough experience: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30977

~ Credits & Thanks ~
. Hardarg for the Aerith outfit which inspired me to make the staffs
. Mr Dave for his Texture Resource (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2324)
author: Denki Groove
